elements.title: Cas9 senses CRISPR RNA abundance to regulate CRISPR spacer acquisition
elements.contents:
Cas9 senses CRISPR RNA abundance to regulate CRISPR spacer acquisition

  • Xufei Zhou
  • Rucheng Diao
  • Yan Zhang
Article03 Sept 2025

elements.title: Latent resistance mechanisms of steel truss bridges after critical failures
elements.contents:
Latent resistance mechanisms of steel truss bridges after critical failures

Experimental tests and computational simulations of a scaled-down specimen of a real steel truss bridge identify and characterize the latent resistance mechanisms following critical failures, demonstrating how loads supported by failed components can be redistributed and enable structure resilience.

  • Juan C. Reyes-Suárez
  • Manuel Buitrago
  • Jose M. Adam
ArticleOpen Access03 Sept 2025

elements.title: DNA2 enables growth by restricting recombination-restarted replication
elements.contents:
DNA2 enables growth by restricting recombination-restarted replication

DNA2 suppresses recombination-restarted replication and checkpoint activation at stalled forks, and its loss triggers recombination-dependent synthesis, checkpoint signalling and cell-cycle exit, highlighting its essential role in proliferation and growth failure in primordial dwarfism.

  • Jessica J. R. Hudson
  • Rowin Appanah
  • Ulrich Rass
ArticleOpen Access03 Sept 2025

elements.title: A prudent planetary limit for geologic carbon storage
elements.contents:
A prudent planetary limit for geologic carbon storage

A risk-based, spatially explicit analysis of carbon storage in sedimentary basins establishes a prudent planetary limit of around 1,460 Gt of geological carbon storage, which requires making explicit decisions on priorities for storage use.

  • Matthew J. Gidden
  • Siddharth Joshi
  • Joeri Rogelj
ArticleOpen Access03 Sept 2025

elements.title: A brain-wide map of neural activity during complex behaviour
elements.contents:
A brain-wide map of neural activity during complex behaviour

The International Brain Laboratory presents a brain-wide electrophysiological map obtained from pooling data from 12 laboratories that performed the same standardized perceptual decision-making task in mice.

  • Leenoy Meshulam
  • Dora Angelaki
  • Ilana B. Witten
ArticleOpen Access03 Sept 2025

elements.title: Divergent evolutionary strategies pre-empt tissue collision in gastrulation
elements.contents:
Divergent evolutionary strategies pre-empt tissue collision in gastrulation

Flies have evolved two distinct strategies for managing mechanical stresses during embryogenesis: out-of-plane cell division in midges and transient out-of-plane tissue folding in fruit flies.

  • Bipasha Dey
  • Verena Kaul
  • Steffen Lemke
ArticleOpen Access03 Sept 2025

elements.title: Analog optical computer for AI inference and combinatorial optimization
elements.contents:
Analog optical computer for AI inference and combinatorial optimization

An analog optical computer that combines analog electronics, three-dimensional optics, and an iterative architecture accelerates artificial intelligence inference and combinatorial optimization in a single platform, paving a promising path for faster and sustainable computing.

  • Kirill P. Kalinin
  • Jannes Gladrow
  • Hitesh Ballani
ArticleOpen Access03 Sept 2025

elements.title: Single-cell transcriptomic and genomic changes in the ageing human brain
elements.contents:
Single-cell transcriptomic and genomic changes in the ageing human brain

Sequencing analyses of human prefrontal cortex from donors ranging in age from 0.4 to 104 years show that ageing correlates with an accumulation of somatic mutations in short housekeeping genes and a reduction in the expression of these genes.

  • Ailsa M. Jeffries
  • Tianxiong Yu
  • Michael A. Lodato
ArticleOpen Access03 Sept 2025

elements.title: A circuit that integrates drive state and social contact to gate mating
elements.contents:
A circuit that integrates drive state and social contact to gate mating

Analyses of consummatory reproductive behaviours in male mice uncover a brain mechanism whereby an internal state can attribute a social quality to a generic touch to initiate purposeful reproductive actions.

  • Lindsey D. Salay
  • Doris Y. Tsao
  • David J. Anderson
ArticleOpen Access03 Sept 2025

elements.title: Spatial joint profiling of DNA methylome and transcriptome in tissues
elements.contents:
Spatial joint profiling of DNA methylome and transcriptome in tissues

DNA-methylation and gene-expression profiling of tissue sections at near single-cell resolution can be used to create detailed spatial maps showing how methylation and transcription interact to shape cell identity and tissue development.

  • Chin Nien Lee
  • Hongxiang Fu
  • Yanxiang Deng
ArticleOpen Access03 Sept 2025

elements.title: Patterned invagination prevents mechanical instability during gastrulation
elements.contents:
Patterned invagination prevents mechanical instability during gastrulation

In Drosophila, the cephalic furrow counteracts mechanical stress as the developing head and the trunk tissues meet, providing evidence for how mechanical forces influence the evolution of morphogenetic innovations in early development.

  • Bruno C. Vellutini
  • Marina B. Cuenca
  • Pavel Tomancak
ArticleOpen Access03 Sept 2025

elements.title: Brain-wide representations of prior information in mouse decision-making
elements.contents:
Brain-wide representations of prior information in mouse decision-making

Brain-wide recordings in mice reveal that prior expectations are distributed through recurrent loops across all levels of cortical and subcortical processing.

  • Charles Findling
  • Felix Hubert
  • Alexandre Pouget
ArticleOpen Access03 Sept 2025

elements.title: A nanobody specific to prefusion glycoprotein B neutralizes HSV-1 and HSV-2
elements.contents:
A nanobody specific to prefusion glycoprotein B neutralizes HSV-1 and HSV-2

A neutralizing nanobody specific to the prefusion conformation of herpes simplex virus glycoprotein B has cross-species activity and offers insights into virus neutralization, possible immunogens and an attractive avenue for antiviral interventions.

  • Benjamin Vollmer
  • Henriette Ebel
  • Kay Grünewald
ArticleOpen Access03 Sept 2025

elements.title: Adaptive and context-aware volumetric printing
elements.contents:
Adaptive and context-aware volumetric printing

A new approach combining 3D imaging, computer vision and parametric modelling, named GRACE, is introduced, enabling adaptive and context-aware 3D printing of structures around features ranging from cellular to macroscopic scales with minimal user intervention.

  • Sammy Florczak
  • Gabriel Größbacher
  • Riccardo Levato
ArticleOpen Access03 Sept 2025

elements.title: 3D-printed micro ion trap technology for quantum information applications
elements.contents:
3D-printed micro ion trap technology for quantum information applications

High-resolution 3D printing technology making use of two-photon polymerization instead of traditional machining is described, allowing low-cost and scalable production of large arrays of high-quality 3D Paul traps.

  • Shuqi Xu
  • Xiaoxing Xia
  • Hartmut Häffner
Article03 Sept 2025

elements.title: Supervised learning in DNA neural networks
elements.contents:
Supervised learning in DNA neural networks

DNA molecules can be programmed to autonomously carry out supervised learning in vitro, with the system learning to perform pattern classification from molecular examples of inputs and desired responses.

  • Kevin M. Cherry
  • Lulu Qian
ArticleOpen Access03 Sept 2025

elements.title: Commensal yeast promotes Salmonella Typhimurium virulence
elements.contents:
Commensal yeast promotes Salmonella Typhimurium virulence

Commensal Candida albicans enhances the virulence and dissemination of Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Typhimurium.

  • Kanchan Jaswal
  • Olivia A. Todd
  • Judith Behnsen
ArticleOpen Access03 Sept 2025

elements.title: PICALM Alzheimer’s risk allele causes aberrant lipid droplets in microglia
elements.contents:
PICALM Alzheimer’s risk allele causes aberrant lipid droplets in microglia

A PICALM allele associated with increased risk of late-onset Alzheimer’s disease has a microglial-specific role in lipid droplet accumulation.

  • Alena Kozlova
  • Siwei Zhang
  • Jubao Duan
ArticleOpen Access03 Sept 2025

elements.title: Infrastructure deficits and informal settlements in sub-Saharan Africa
elements.contents:
Infrastructure deficits and informal settlements in sub-Saharan Africa

A new network approach maps every street block in sub-Saharan Africa using high-resolution building and street data, pinpointing infrastructure needs and revealing development gradients from neighbourhoods to cities and rural areas.

  • Luís M. A. Bettencourt
  • Nicholas Marchio
ArticleOpen Access03 Sept 2025

elements.title: Amygdala–liver signalling orchestrates glycaemic responses to stress
elements.contents:
Amygdala–liver signalling orchestrates glycaemic responses to stress

Studies in mice show that acute stress activates hyperglycaemia via activation of a medial amygdala–ventral hypothalamic circuit that controls glucose metabolic responses in the liver, independently of adrenal and pancreatic hormones.

  • J. R. E. Carty
  • K. Devarakonda
  • S. A. Stanley
ArticleOpen Access03 Sept 2025
